case_vignette: A 22-year-old woman with polycystic ovarian syndrome comes to the emergency department because of a 1-day history of left lower abdominal pain that began suddenly while she was running. Her last menstrual period was 2 weeks ago. Physical examination shows tenderness to palpation over the left adnexa and rebound tenderness in the left lower quadrant. There is no tenderness in the right lower quadrant. Urine pregnancy test is negative. An ultrasound is ordered to confirm the diagnosis of ruptured ovarian cyst.
question: Visualization of fluid in which  locations would be most consistent with this diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Obstetrics and Gynecology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have pain in my lower left abdomen that started suddenly yesterday while I was running.
Got it. Have you experienced any nausea or vomiting along with the pain?
No, I haven't had any nausea or vomiting.
Understood. Have you noticed any changes in your bowel habits recently?
No, my bowel habits haven't changed recently.
Do you have a history of any gynecological issues or surgeries?
Yes, I have polycystic ovarian syndrome.
I see. Have you had any recent trauma or injury to your lower abdomen?
No, I haven't had any recent injury to my lower abdomen.
Is there a history of ovarian cysts or other gynecological issues in your family?
I don’t know about the history of ovarian cysts or other gynecological issues in my family.
I understand. Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle?
My last menstrual period was 2 weeks ago.

Thank you. Based on your symptoms and medical history, as well as the absence of other concerning symptoms, it's likely that you are experiencing a ruptured ovarian cyst.
 
**Final Diagnosis:** Ruptured Ovarian Cyst
